wikipedia_page.main: Arthur James Michael Milner, 2nd Baron Milner of Leeds (12 September 1923 – 20 August 2003) was a British solicitor and Labour politician.

link_mentions.page: Arthur Milner, 2nd Baron Milner of Leeds
response: #REDIRECT Michael Milner, 2nd Baron Milner of Leeds

Lord HolmPatrick was a Labour peer until 1999, when most of the hereditary peers were removed from the House of Lords by the House of Lords Act 1999. Lord HolmPatrick was not one of those 15 hereditary peers elected by the whole House nor one of those 2 peers elected by the Labour hereditary. In 2003 Lord HolmPatrick stood to be one of the Labour peers following the death of Michael Milner, 2nd Baron Milner of Leeds, but was defeated by Christopher Suenson-Taylor, 3rd Baron Grantchester.
*Michael Milner, 2nd Baron Milner of Leeds (1923–2003), British solicitor and politician

link_mentions.page: Richard Milner, 3rd Baron Milner of Leeds
response: Milner is the only son of Michael Milner, 2nd Baron Milner of Leeds, he was educated at Charterhouse School and the University of Surrey (BSc).‘MILNER OF LEEDS’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 He succeeded to the peerage upon the death of his father in 2003.
